tags: Curt Teich Postcard Archives Digital Collection
description: Trinidad is in the center of a large mineral district; coal mining, manufacturing of coke, iron, mineral paint, lime, fire brick, and lumber are the principal industries of Trinidad, although it is the largest wool and hide shipping point in Colorado. The city is surrounded by beautiful mountain scenery. The flat-topped peak on the range beyond is known as Fisher's Peak, while nearby is Simpson's Rest. Altitude 5,982 feet. Population 7,000.
